spec.title: Marrakech Street Food Tour
spec.description: A culinary journey through the streets of Marrakech, from breakfast to late-night snacks.

steps.title: Start at Jemaa el-Fna
steps.description: Start your journey in the lively main square of Marrakech.

steps.title: Enjoy a Marrakchi Breakfast
steps.description: Try a traditional Marrakech breakfast with batbout bread, local butter, honey, and olive oil. You can find it near Jemaa el-Fna, Talaa, or around the city.

steps.title: Warm Up with Bissara
steps.description: Have a hot bowl of Marrakchi bissara, made with fava beans and green peas, often cooked in a tangia style.

steps.title: Taste Loubia for Brunch
steps.description: Eat slow-cooked white beans at a famous local spot in Talaa Market. Go before noon to get a seat.

steps.title: Try Smen Kefta
steps.description: Taste kefta cooked with smen (aged butter), a dish that is special to Marrakech.

steps.title: Discover Chicken Tangia
steps.description: Try chicken tangia, a less common but very tasty version of this famous dish.

steps.title: Eat Marrakchi Mechoui
steps.description: Enjoy slow-roasted lamb cooked in underground ovens, a classic Marrakech specialty.

steps.title: Taste Sweets in the Medina
steps.description: Try traditional Moroccan pastries, especially around the Semmarine area.

steps.title: Eat Sfenj Donuts
steps.description: Enjoy fresh Moroccan donuts, plain or served with a fried egg if available.

steps.title: Drink Special Tea and Coffee
steps.description: Have herbal tea, including merdedouch, or try sand-cooked coffee, a local specialty.

steps.title: Try Local Sandwiches
steps.description: Taste unique Marrakech sandwiches like spleen, mixed meat, charcoal shawarma, and khobza ajiba.

steps.title: Drink a Panache in Dabachi
steps.description: Have a famous local panache juice made with avocado, strawberry, and almonds.

steps.title: End with Harira at Mmi Fatima
steps.description: Finish the evening with harira soup, dates, chebbakia, and eggs.

steps.title: Return for Tangia and Baolo
steps.description: Go back to the square to enjoy more tangia and the local baolo bread.

steps.title: Finish with Tea and Snails
steps.description: End the night with spiced tea and a bowl of snails.
